TopicTitle: [1.12.x] TAC - Life Support v0.18.0 - Release 19th Sep 2021

Articles.Content: Which version works on 1.4.5?

7 hours ago, KerbalSofaProgram said:

This mod does add the quarter cylinder shaped air filters, water purifiers, etc., right? if so, i dont have access to them and i can provide any relevant information if needed. if not then...  nvm

I believe you are referring to Kerbal Planetary Base System.  With TAC-LS installed, KPBS adds life support parts in it's own design shape to slot into the racks provided by the mod.

You might also be referring to Universal Storage/Universal Storage II.  In 1.25m rocket stacks it provides 1/4 cylinder sized parts for LS mods.

Edited November 5, 2018 by overkill13
@JPLRepo many thanks for bringing this up to date!

Hi,

Started using TAC LS in 1.5.1. I have a small issue with EC usage in background processing.

I have three space stations that use solar panels and a lander on the surface of Minmus that uses two Near Future MX-0 generators. During warp (never higher than 7), the stations update their EC usage nicely, but the lander never updates. I read that generators should also work in background. Is there a way you check for a generator part on a vessel to include in background processing? If so, I can look at the part config to see if it's compatible.'

Thanks

Hi,I im using this mod over 1 month.StockAlike Station Parts Expansion Greenhouses requires CO2 and water.Tried USI and KPBS;dropped it.uninstalled USI but greenhouses still requires Fertilizer.How to solve it?

7 minutes ago, Eaten by Black Hole said:

Hi,I im using this mod over 1 month.StockAlike Station Parts Expansion Greenhouses requires CO2 and water.Tried USI and KPBS;dropped it.uninstalled USI but greenhouses still requires Fertilizer.How to solve it?

Not sure what the question is...

2 minutes ago, Gilph said:

Not sure what the question is...

Does TAC includes Fertilizer?If not,why my greenhouses still requires fertilizer?

Just now, Eaten by Black Hole said:

Does TAC includes Fertilizer?If not,why my greenhouses still requires fertilizer?

Ahhh, OK

I have just been through this recently. The life support resources that TAC defines and uses do not include or need Fertilizer. The TAC converters take the resources that TAC defined and will convert them to other TAC resources, like Waste Water to Water. or CO2 to Oxygen. The only thing it doesn't do is make Food. So. you have to rely on other mods, and they may introduce other resources, like Fertilizer

If you use SSPXr, you have two types of parts: the fish tank and the greenhouses. As you found out, the greenhouses need Fertilizer as one of the inputs. The fish tank has an algae farm that creates Fertilizer from Waste and Ore. So you need the fish tank if you want to make Fertilizer for those greenhouses. Or, you can use another greenhouse, like the SETI one, that uses TAC resources and Nutrients, which the part makes itself, so you dont need anything else. Also, you can edit the config of the greenhouses and remove the Fertilizer requirement and use something else.

12 minutes ago, Eaten by Black Hole said:

Does TAC includes Fertilizer?If not,why my greenhouses still requires fertilizer?

TAC does not include any greenhouses for itself. These are only to be found in other mods, some of which are nothing more than greenhouses for use with TAC.

 

25 minutes ago, Eaten by Black Hole said:

Hi,I im using this mod over 1 month.StockAlike Station Parts Expansion Greenhouses requires CO2 and water.Tried USI and KPBS;dropped it.uninstalled USI but greenhouses still requires Fertilizer.How to solve it?

SSPXr greenhouses use KPBS resource chain (which includes Fertilizer) if KPBS and TAC are installed......so uninstall KPBS lol.

That's odd. The SETI converter is not usually part of SSPXr or TAC. I have the same setup and had to Install the SETI greenhouse separately. I did so specifically to not have to deal with Fertilizer on space stations that I'm sending to far planets. I use the SSPXr fish tank and greenhouses on stations around small moons that I can send an ore driller down and back easily (like Minmus).
